item.title: Report E-2023090365
item.description:
Report E-2023090365

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: SALEM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSW experienced a 5-ounce release of UN3103 NOROX SHP-75 from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and located the 5-gallon plastic jug of product. There was a small pin hole on the bottom of the jug but no evidence of a release in the vicinity. ERTS was informed there was a small release inside the trailer but that had since moved on. The crew placed the jug into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023081233
item.description:
Report X-2023081233

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When I came in for my shift today I seen that this package was on a cart in front of the hazmat cage. I seen that the closers were open and that there was dried wet marks on the side of the package, I open the package and seen that the inner containers were wet, I followed through with a DPR and HESS process DescribePack: appears to have loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed upright

item.title: Report X-2023081212
item.description:
Report X-2023081212

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: MOKENA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet package was discovered in work area. QA admin placed package in hazmat bag and hazmat drum immediately upon discovery. DescribePack: Small puncture in one can with 85% of contents leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: There was no spilling in work area, so mitigation efforts only included placing package inside hazmat bag and hazmat drum.

item.title: Report X-2023081195
item.description:
Report X-2023081195

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The flammable liquid marked package was located in the haz cage open. Further inspection of the package confirmed that one of the bottles had released its liquid contents inside due to a loose cap DescribePack: loose cap, Cap tightened DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed under hood

item.title: Report X-2023081132
item.description:
Report X-2023081132

item.title: Report X-2023082060
item.description:
Report X-2023082060

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: CAROL STREAM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package containing 4 plastic bottles of ethanol. The box and bottles are wet from one of the bottles being punctured and spilled half of liquid. Box was torn on a corner matching the marks on damaged bottle. Box was damaged while being unloaded from trailer. Fisher trailer was not placed on right door to unload pallet of hazmat's and still ended up being unloaded. Hazmat's needed to be placed on correct unload door in order to avoid issues like this, could cause damages and other issues as well. DescribePack: Box was torn on a corner side, and also wet from spilled bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside a hazmat bag inside a plastic bin with absorbent pads.

item.title: Report X-2023081945
item.description:
Report X-2023081945

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-26
  • City: CAROL STREAM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat pail that is in puddle inside a plastic bin inside the hazmat cage. The pail was being unloaded from the van and as it was getting placed down on the platform, the pail was punctured by a metal part of platform sticking out. The pail leaked a small amount but cannot be lifted or it will leak. Hazmat also seems too big to be placed inside a yellow salvage drum and should be picked up by a third party if possible. DescribePack: Pail has a puncture hole on bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside a plastic bin with hazmat bag.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package containing a 5-gal bag of formic acid. The box was stained from spilled liquid that the hazmat had due to what looks like a loose or defective cap. There is a small puddle around the cap and no punctured holes are seen. Spilled around a liter or two. DescribePack: Package was stained from liquid spill, spill was a bit dried up. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside a hazmat bag inside a plastic bin with absorbent pads.

AFTER CONTAINERIZING THE SPILL AND RETURNING TO DMP AREA, RESPONDER INSPECTED THE SOURCE OF LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION ONE OF THE BOTTLE CAPS TOPS HAD A CRACK. THE CONTAINERS AND PACKAGING WAS SATURATED FROM SAID LEAK.

item.title: Report X-2023061370
item.description:
Report X-2023061370

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-19
  • City: NORTHBROOK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE MARKED AS UN3373 BIOLOGICAL SUBSTANCE, CATEGORY B WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING A RED SUBSTANCE AT THE UPS FACILITY IN NORTHBROOK, ILLINOIS. UPON INSPECTION THERE WAS AN UNFROZEN VASCULAR TISSUE SAMPLE THAT WAS CONTAINED IN A PLASTIC BAG NOT FULLY SEALED. THE PARTIALLY SEALED BAG WAS CONTAINED WITHIN A STYROFOAM INSULATING BOX ALONG WITH ONE ICE PACK ON THE BOTTOM. THE STYROFOAM LID WAS NOT FULLY CLOSED AND A WATERY RED LIQUID HAD LEAKED FROM THE PARTIALLY OPENED LID. THE OUTER CARTON WAS WET AND STAINED AN ORANGE-RED COLOR. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM VETERINARY SPECIALTY CENTER, 2501 WAUKEGAN RD, BANNOCKBURN, IL 60015 USING UPS ACCOUNT 642677, U OF I DIAGNOSTIC LAB, 20015 S LINCOLN, URBANA, IL 61802. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
